Vaccination.description: The act of administering a vaccine to prevent infectious diseases

ImmuneResponse.description: The body's response to vaccination, leading to immunity

HerdImmunity.description: Protection of a population from an infectious disease when a sufficient percentage of individuals are immune

AntibodyProduction.description: Production of antibodies that target and neutralize pathogens

MemoryCells.description: Long-lived immune cells that provide rapid and long-lasting immunity

ReducedTransmission.description: Reduced spread of infectious diseases within a population

DiseaseEradication.description: Complete elimination of an infectious disease from a population or region

Neutralization.description: Direct inactivation of pathogens by antibodies

Opsonization.description: Enhancement of pathogen uptake and destruction by immune cells

RapidResponse.description: Faster and more effective immune response upon subsequent exposure to the pathogen

LongTermProtection.description: Long-lasting immunity that may reduce or eliminate the need for repeated vaccinations

LowerInfectionRates.description: Lower rates of infection and associated illnesses

FewerOutbreaks.description: Reduced frequency and severity of disease outbreaks

PublicHealthImprovement.description: Overall improvement in public health outcomes

EconomicBenefits.description: Economic benefits associated with reduced healthcare costs and increased workforce productivity

PathogenInactivation.description: Direct inactivation of the pathogen, preventing infection

PreventionOfInfection.description: Prevention of infection by neutralizing the pathogen before it can cause disease

EnhancedPhagocytosis.description: Enhanced uptake and destruction of pathogens by phagocytic cells

ImprovedImmuneClearance.description: Improved clearance of pathogens from the body

FasterImmuneActivation.description: Faster activation of the immune system upon subsequent exposure

ReducedDiseaseSeverity.description: Reduced severity of illness upon subsequent exposure

SustainedImmunity.description: Long-lasting immunity against the targeted pathogen
